content.description: After matching the lip on Tremor stay slighty right to climb straight up between the bailout Jug on Tremor and the right arete.

SO GOOD!! 

  find the low left facing corner at the base of the boulder to SDS in. Match the thin crimp seam and pull a difficult start up to better slots. make a long move off on incuts to the lip. match lip to top out left through huge jugs.
Start on the right arete of the boulder and traverse to gain the low, mid point of the boulder where "Dry Mouth"(V3) climbs through.
Start low and to the left of "Tremor" on a left facing jug and right hand crimp. Climb straight up to dominate the massive jug over the lip. top out.

On the left side of the boulder where there is a small 1-2 ft dropoff at the base and to the R of "Anxiety".  Grab two tiny crimpers, smear a foot and make a huge move out and R to a perfect sloper at the lip.  Match and mantle.  HARD one move wonder.
Start same as per "Impotence"  but trend left into low point in the boulder to top out.
Start low on the right arete and climb through the jugs to the fun top out which is the crux. Be sure to give your friends a hard time over the top out humping. Mantle through either side. FUN!!
SDS in small L facing corner at the far left side of the Zoloft Boulder, climb up and R along lip, mantle lip.  Beautiful views of the valley below from the problem.  Nice line for the grade.
content.location: Far L side of Zoloft Boulder

content.description:
The Zoloft Boulder is awesome! 

  Walk through the corridor, and instead of turning left, keep going through the scrub via the small foot path (if you can find it). its a medium sized boulder with super fun problems across it. Try "Decreased Sex Drive"(V1) and "Tremor"(V6) while youre there! 

  Jay says: 

  I know the History on this Boulder! Seth Blanchard and I "discovered" this boulder hidden in a jungle of Rhododendron or Mountain Laurel (can't remember which). It is literally within sight from the corridor but yet no one ever clawed there way through the bushes to see this small looking boulder. To our surprise the boulder was taller than it looked and was slightly overhanging on the front side. After hours of serious Lichen Scrubbing Seth and I put up Decreased Sex Drive and the other easier lines and we began working Tremor. After a few trips to the knob it finally went down on cooler temps. A nice eliminate line remains going straight up to the apex of the boulder just left of where Decreased Sex Drive tops out. The current line jumps Left to the path of least resistance to the Thank God Jugs! Adam Walker also put up a sick one move wonder from two tiny crimpers to a sweet sloper on the left side of the boulder!
